009package GenericFilterDemos;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
015import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.Kernel2D;
016import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.LinearFilter;
017import imagingbook.common.ij.IjProgressBarMonitor;
018import imagingbook.common.util.progress.ProgressMonitor;
019
020/**
021 * This ImageJ plugin shows how to construct a generic linear filter
022 * using the classes {@link LinearFilter} and {@link Kernel2D}.
023 * It also shows the use of classes {@link ProgressMonitor} and
024 * {@link IjProgressBarMonitor}
025 * This plugin works for all types of images.
026 * On RGB color images, the filter is applied independently
027 * to the three color channels.
028 * The active image is modified.
029 * 
030 * @author WB
031 *
032 * @see GenericFilter
033 * @see LinearFilter
034 */
035public class Linear_Filter_3x3 implements PlugInFilter {
036        
037        private static float[][] H = {  // 3x3 smoothing kernel
038                        {1, 2, 1},
039                        {2, 4, 2},
040                        {1, 2, 1}};
041        
042//      private static float[][] H = {  // 2D impulse
043//                      {0, 0, 0},
044//                      {0, 1, 0},
045//                      {0, 0, 0}};
046
047    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
048        return DOES_ALL;
049    }
050
051    public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
052        GenericFilter filter = new LinearFilter(new Kernel2D(H));
053        try (ProgressMonitor m = new IjProgressBarMonitor(filter)) {
054                m.setWaitTime(100);     // 100ms (default is 250ms)
055                filter.applyTo(ip);
056        }
057    }
058
059}
